content:
@Tim Abbott Thoughts on this design?
Screenshot-2017-11-16-Zulip-the-best-group-chat-for-open-source-projects.png
Also what's the hsl of the Zulip green/cyan color?
Maybe include a "grand total" as the default?
(I had actually mostly been thinking of a "grand total" as the thing to do in general)
Please rename Electron to Desktop :P
Oh yeah, good idea.
As a sidenote, @Akash Nimare, should we rename zulip-electron to zulip-desktop?
(the repo)

Maybe have checkboxes that filter which repo contributions to display?

Please rename Electron to Desktop :P

Yeah ok :D
I think checkboxes is probably excessive; folks are probably either interested in just-one-repo or all of them, not something in-between :)

As a sidenote, @Akash Nimare, should we rename zulip-electron to zulip-desktop?

I'm cool as long as https://github.com/zulip/zulip-electron/ auto- redirects to https://github.com/zulip/zulip-desktop ?

I think checkboxes is probably excessive; folks are probably either interested in just-one-repo or all of them, not something in-between :)

Ok so a new tab which shows the grand total?
@Akash Nimare Yeah, it'll auto-redirect.
@Tommy Ip yep :)
OK one other question we should think about. We have a few sorta legacy repos (zulip-ios, zulip-android)
Do we want to include those as well (probably doesn't make sense for them to appear as tabs, since they're not current, but it could make sense to include them in the totals)

I guess I definitely don't want update-authors-json to be downloading data for those each time (since it's slow enough as-is), but it could be reasonable to just check in the "final" data for those repos using the fixture strategy?
Probably it's enough work we should finish the main thing first, but I'm curious for people's thoughts on it.

Yeah it would be reasonable to freeze the data for those legacy repos and check them into version control. I think what we should do is show icons/badges on each person in the grand total tab which repos they have worked on.
OK. I'd probably skip the badges for v1.
BTW, I just had an exchange with the GitHub support team about why it gets non-200 responses.
it = update-authors-json.

I think we're getting HTTP 202 responses, which are basically "I'm working, come back in 5 seconds once I've calculated it", which suggests we may want to tweak our retry loop to (1) try more times and (2) wait a second between tries.
OK yeah, given that we are about to fetch even more repos and wait longer for each one, does it make sense to span up a tornado instance to fetch contributors data async-ly?
I think it'd be fine to just try to fetch them all, and then have a loop that waits 2s and retries until every one has succeeded or it's failed 10 times.
async io would be nicer than a time.sleep() loop only if we knew when to try again, which we don't.
cool ok

I think it would be more appropriate to render each tab with JS instead of jinja (reduce code duplication/allows more sorting logic). @Tim Abbott where should I include the JS file (landing-page.js / new team.js)?
Hmm, I think a team.js that goes into the landing-page.js bundle is fine; just scope the logic with selectors. It's best to avoid adding new bundles unless there's a good reason.
https://stripe.com/about That is a cool team page design, the motion doesn't seem very smooth for me though.
Yeah, though being a giant company with dozens of designers, I bet they spent person-months on it :)

This may be more about the underlying script than the page itself, but I noticed my commits to the zulip repo which were migrated to the api repo were counted twice. While that puts me in a positive light to some degree (!), it doesn't seem representative; I'm not sure the basic script as-is allows this kind of distinction - and the commits have different ids in the repos, so I think it'd just be the commit title that could be used to discriminate?

Yeah Tim raised that concern as well https://github.com/zulip/zulip/pull/7470#issuecomment-346118561 (second point) and a potential solution https://github.com/zulip/zulip/pull/7470#issuecomment-346452888
@Tommy Ip maybe it's worth creating an issue for these so the solution doesn't get lost?
